title: 1957 Labour Party Shadow Cabinet election
text:
Elections to the <a href="Labour%20Party%20%28UK%29">Labour Party</a>'s <a href="Official%20Opposition%20Shadow%20Cabinet%20%28United%20Kingdom%29">Shadow Cabinet</a> (more formally, its "Parliamentary Committee") occurred in November 1957. In addition to the 12 members elected, the <a href="Leader%20of%20the%20Labour%20Party%20%28UK%29">Leader</a> (<a href="Hugh%20Gaitskell">Hugh Gaitskell</a>), <a href="Deputy%20Leader%20of%20the%20Labour%20Party%20%28UK%29">Deputy Leader</a> (<a href="Jim%20Griffiths">Jim Griffiths</a>), <a href="Labour%20Chief%20Whip">Labour Chief Whip</a> (<a href="Herbert%20Bowden%2C%20Baron%20Aylestone">Herbert Bowden</a>), Labour Leader in the House of Lords (<a href="A.%20V.%20Alexander">A. V. Alexander</a>) were automatically members.
The results of the election are listed below:
† Multiple candidates tied for position.
